Uses of Class
tripleplay.ui.MenuHost.Pop

Packages that use MenuHost.Pop
tripleplay.ui   
 

Uses of MenuHost.Pop in tripleplay.ui
 

Methods in tripleplay.ui that return MenuHost.Pop
 MenuHost.Pop MenuHost.Pop.atEventPos(playn.core.Events.Position pos)
          Positions the menu popup at the given positional event.
 MenuHost.Pop MenuHost.Pop.atLayerX(playn.core.Layer layer, float x)
          Positions the menu horizontally relative to the given layer, with an offset.
 MenuHost.Pop MenuHost.Pop.atLayerY(playn.core.Layer layer, float y)
          Positions the menu vertically relative to the given layer, with an offset.
 MenuHost.Pop MenuHost.Pop.atScreenPos(float x, float y)
          Positions the menu popup at the given screen position.
 MenuHost.Pop MenuHost.Pop.inElement(Element<?> elem)
          Optionally confines the menu area to the given element.
 MenuHost.Pop MenuHost.Pop.inScreenArea(pythagoras.f.IRectangle area)
          Optionally confines the menu area to the given screen area.
 MenuHost.Pop MenuHost.Pop.relayEvents(playn.core.Layer layer)
          Causes the menu to handle further events on the given layer.
 MenuHost.Pop MenuHost.Pop.retainMenu()
          Flags this Pop event so that the menu will not be destroyed automatically when it is deactivated.
 MenuHost.Pop MenuHost.Pop.toBottom(float y)
          Positions the menu vertically relative to the bottom edge of the trigger.
 MenuHost.Pop MenuHost.Pop.toLeft(float x)
          Positions the menu horizontally relative to the left edge of the trigger.
 MenuHost.Pop MenuHost.Pop.toRight(float x)
          Positions the menu horizontally relative to the right edge of the trigger.
 MenuHost.Pop MenuHost.Pop.toTop(float y)
          Positions the menu vertically relative to the top edge of the trigger.
 

Methods in tripleplay.ui that return types with arguments of type MenuHost.Pop
 react.Slot<MenuHost.Pop> MenuHost.onPopup()
          Directs a menu pop signal to MenuHost.popup(Pop).
 

Methods in tripleplay.ui with parameters of type MenuHost.Pop
 void MenuHost.popup(MenuHost.Pop pop)
          Displays the menu specified by the given pop, incorporating all the configured attributes therein.
